intro: Condalia parryi, commonly known as the parry's condalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a dense inflorescence called a cyathium. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Condalia parryi is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
